Consider a system where a matrix function \\( u(x) \\) evolves according to \\( \\frac{du}{dx} = M u(x) \\), with \\( M \\) being a constant matrix. We also look into the effect of an integral transform \\( T(u) = \\int e^{Nx} u(x) dx \\), where \\( N \\) is another constant matrix.

If we have the result of the transformation \\( T(u) \\) computed at some \\( x = X \\), can we determine the original vector \\( u_0 \\) and the matrix \\( M \\) without any baseline information?
Explanation: Since the transformation involves integration with a function involving \\( N \\), both \\( u_0 \\) and \\( M \\) contribute in a non-trivial, intertwined way in the result. Without additional information on either, different combinations of \\( u_0 \\) and \\( M \\) can give the same integral result.
